data.title: Indie films and blockbusters shown...
data.text: Always a fun place to go and it's the last movie theatre in Downtown Colorado Springs. There are three theatres in the building and they're usually GOOD movies. AND you can take your wine or beer from the bar to your seat! Often this is the only place in town to play the smaller Indie films. It's just a great place to be,

data.title: Something for everyone
data.text: This older theater in Colorado Springs is a great venue.  Yummy popcorn. Full bar.  You can enjoy interesting films that are not always shown at the larger chain theaters in the city.

data.title: Amazing venue for a night out Downtown!
data.text: This place is literally like a second home to me - I feel like I'm here almost all the time! The "crossover" films that play here (generally the "arthouse" side projects of big name actors) range greatly across genres, so it seems like there's always something for everyone! Add to that the fact you can get a great craft beer and bring it into the auditorium? I'm sold!

data.title: Perfect for evening out!!!!
data.text:
They redid the chairs (for sure in theatre one, not sure about the others) and they are much nicer! Very comfortable, rose nice arm rests and a dramatic improvement from the older chairs. You can't beat a bar in a theatre! The wine and beer is always good and the prices are fantastic. 

The entire staff is always incredibly friendly and welcoming. My date and I drove separately once and due to traffic and parking (obviously not their fault!) my date was quite late. While I waited in the lobby the staff member offered to give me ticket passes to come another time. I didn't ask for anything, didn't print, or in any way hint at a comp at all. He offered the passes completely unprompted which I thought was above and beyond cool because clearly they had no obligation to compensate me tickets just because one of us couldn't find parking. 

We LOVE their independent movies, the times are good, small crowds and I am forever loyal to The Peak theater. I have been since growing up here and even more recently and since the renovation they have become even better. 

(My only desire would be is if they fixed the carpet and weird uneven-ness) but I imagine that is out of their control. New carpet would be nice though. 

Love you guys!

data.title: Great place to watch great films
data.text: While not every film I have seen here has been awesome I rarely see something that is bad.  They are always playing interesting films that you will not find at the big theaters.  Great location in downtown Colorado Springs and close to many great restaurants which we visit after a movie.  Another bonus is the full bar available in the theater.  They have a small selection of good beers on tap, several wines and a full stock of liquor if that is your thing.

data.title: This place is a riot!  Wine and a movie!
data.text: We took in the Martian in this historic bar/theatre.  It was my 1st time doing something like this and it was a blast!  Who doesn't love a good movie in a fun theatre with a glass of wine!

data.title: Peaceful historic building to see up to date movies...sells beer and wine in relaxed enviroment
data.text: Went to see "JOY" in the largest of three theatres. I love the atmosphere and the slower pace of this theatre. Runs up to date first run movies.  Crowd is more mature and I enjoy beer and wine being available.  I love to know I am supporting a local small business owner. Ticket sales person was very polite and didn't try to rush me.  Skipped popcorn this time.....went for a cold stella...yum

data.title: Management tolerates employees stealing from customers
data.text:
My wife's phone dropped out her purse while watching a movie.

After she left the theater, she realized her phone was missing.

By the time she returned to the theater, find-my-phone showed that the phone had moved out of the theater.

Management refused to deal with the employee who stole the phone, despite having the address of where the phone was. Management could have cross referenced the address with their record of home address of employees, and identified the employee who stole the phone, and I don't know, maybe called the employee to tell him that the lost phone he was keeping for safe keeping had its owner show up. But management refused.

A friend of hers heard about the incident, went to the home of the employee and got the phone back.

data.title: Great Matinee Experience
data.text: We went to the 2:15 showing of 'Dark Places'.  It was fun going to the old downtown theater that has been renovated.  The guys were very friendly, the theater very clean, & some of the best popcorn I've ever had at a theater.   We went to the cinema room upstairs.  The seats were comfy and had drink holders.  Sound was good.  Being able to have a beer was nice.  The only complaint that we could possibly have is the seats aren't in stadium style, inclined so you can see over the person in front of you. The matinee price is reasonable at $7.50.  Other than that it was a great experience.  And the movie let out in perfect time for some appetizers and beer around the corner at a local pub.

data.title: Great theater / cramped seating
data.text:
I really love Kimball's.  It's a great, locally owned, independent gem of a theater.  My favorite thing about them is the bar, and that you can buy a glass of wine and enjoy it with the movie!

I've also found the movie selection to be great.

My only gripe, which is the only thing keeping this from a 5-star review, is seating.  The seats are quite small, but what really gets me is the lack of room between my knees and next row.  This can be mitigated if you get there really early and get the choice seats (not that we ever do).  This is an issue because I have a bad knee and can't keep it bent for really long periods of time (poor me).

Anyway, if you visit the Springs you should not pass up a chance to see a movie here.

data.title: More than a theatre
data.text: This is one of the oldest theaters in Colorado Springs with updated comfy seating & good screen/speakers.  Love that you can get a beer or wine to sip on while enjoying a movie!

data.title: Not the newest but definitely the coolest
data.text: We live in Colorado Spring sand this theatre is our favorite. There are three theatres in the building. One has very nice seats with cup holders. Another has fairly decent seats with cup holders and another has alright seats with holders. But this theatre has class. They serve the very best popcorn with real butter and you can enjoy an adult beverage with your movie. The movie selection isn't the bang bang shut them up kind but more of the type us older generation enjoys. The last movie we saw was "I'll See You In My Dreams".  We just love this place and it may not be the top of the line but you will find us here always instead of the fancy new places with no class or personality. We also love their staff who treat every one great!  We highly recommend.

data.title: Funky and great!
data.text: My husband and I are fans of indie movies and this is the only theater in town that shows them. It is not like Tinseltown or the latest theater. It's funky and old, but a good experience for those of a certain age with memories of the theaters of your youth. If you go before 6, the price is $7.50; after that $9.00. Save room for popcorn! I think they put something in there to addict you because it's wonderful and I don't normally indulge. We like to have a meal next door at La Baguette beforehand. Yum...

data.title: Nice home town theater
data.text: Great old theater.  Parking in this downtown location is a bit of a problem.  Lots of Indie films, many smaller films that the big guys don't run.

data.title: Wine with your movie?
data.text: Great local theater to view the latest films. You can enjoy a freshly cooked snack and an adult beverage in the roomy chairs. These folks have a relaxed atmosphere and their screen and sound rival the multiplex chains.

data.title: The Only Theatre We Go To
data.text: If it's not showing at Kimball's we wait until the movie is on cable or streaming.  Colorado Springs isn't a big metro, so we don't have dinner movie theatres with recliners. What we have is Kimball's. Origionally an art movie theatre, it's expanded to main stream movies as well, and we love that. Walk in, get your tickets and popcorn while talking to ten people you know. Then walk over and get wine or beer to enjoy with your movie and proceed to find a seat. There are handicapped seats if you need them, even big overstuffed chairs if that is your fancy. Locally owned and locally loved.

data.title: Unique and fun!
data.text: This is an older theater, but it's got lots of charm and the best part is that you can drink beer, wine or mixed drinks while you watch the movie.  They have lots of beers and wines to choose from.  My husband had a beer and I had a margarita.  The theater was super convenient to our hotel, The Mining Exchange, and to the restaurant we went to, The Famous.  This theater is fun!

data.title: Better than the huge multiplex theaters
data.text: They showed the advertisements and previews before the movie started...not at the movie start time, which was nice.  $35 for 1 large, 1 small popcorn, 1 bottle water, 1 med soda and 2 tickets.  Clean bathrooms.  Parking was a challenge because the garage they recommend on the website had a malfunctioning automated kiosk...it took our dollar, then wouldn't accept a second try.  We parked in a pay lot across the street because we didn't have any quarters for meters on the street...no free parking.   Clean theatre and comfortable seats.

data.title: Our Favorite Theatre
data.text: We both work downtown and our favorite Friday night activity is to go to the 5:00 time frame show with friends or just us, have a bag of popcorn and a glass of wine and enjoy a great movie. They have independent as well as the best mainstream movies for adults which we just love. Afterwards, there are so many great places downtown to grab a bite for dinner. This theatre is an institution in The Springs and we adore it.

data.title: The Worst
data.text: unfriendly employees, no parking (and if you can find a space, you have to feed a 2 hour meter which is hardly long enough for a movie), old, old, old facilities.  It needs a major renovation!  Too bad, because it's a locally owned business :(
